snippet: At Edith Wharton’s house, the Mount, new drapery has been hung — after years of painstaking research into how she might have decorated the rooms.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; staff at the Mount, writer Edith Wharton's former home turned museum, have made attempt at recreating Wharton's bedroom curtains and other settings based on her writings on decor; Heritage Auctions will sell archives and personal effects of artist Pierre-Auguste Renoir at auction in Manhattan; retrospective of works of book designer Ernst Reichl will open at Columbia University's Rare Book and Manuscript Library.
lead_paragraph: At Edith Wharton’s house, the Mount, new drapery has been hung — after years of painstaking research into how she might have decorated the rooms.

headline.main: Wharton’s Curtains Are Recreated; Renoir’s Letters Go on Sale
